org.judal.storage.table.impl

Class AbstractRecordBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.judal.storage.table.impl.AbstractRecordBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Stored, Record
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractRecord

    public abstract class AbstractRecordBase
extends Object
implements Record

    Partial implementation of Record interface.

    This class contains the getter and setter methods and the JSON and XML writers.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sergio Montoro Ten
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes(String sColName)

        Get column as byte array.

        If the column value is null then null will be returned Else If the column type is byte[] that same value will be returned Else this method will call org.judal.serialization.BytesConverter.toBytes(value, getColumn(sColName).getType()) to convert the column Object into a byte array.
        Specified by:
        getBytes in interface Record
        Parameters:
        sColName - String Column Name
        Returns:
        byte[]

      • getDecimal

        public BigDecimal getDecimal(String sColName)
                      throws NullPointerException,
                             ClassCastException,
                             NumberFormatException

        Get column value as BigDecimal.

        If the actual value of the column is not BigDecimal Then this function will try to convert it to BigDecimal.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        BigDecimal
        Throws:

        ClassCastException

        public int getInt(String sColName)
           throws NullPointerException,
                  ClassCastException,
                  NumberFormatException

        Get value of column as int.

        This function must not be used to retrieve nullable values. If the actual value of the column is not int Then this function will try to convert it to int.

        public com.knowgate.currency.Money getMoney(String sColName)
                                     throws NumberFormatException

        Get value of a VARCHAR field that holds a money+currency amount

        Money values are stored with its currency sign embedded inside, like "26.32 USD" or "$48.3" or "35.44 €"

      • toXML

        public String toXML(String identSpaces,
                    Map<String,String> attribs,
                    DateFormat dateFormat,
                    NumberFormat decimalFormat,
                    Format textFormat)
        Write Record as XML.
        Parameters:
        identSpaces - String Number of indentation spaces at the beginning of each line.
        attribs - Map<String,String> Attributes to add to top node.
        dateFormat - DateFormat Date format. If null then yyyy-MM-DD HH:mm:ss pattern will be used.
        decimalFormat - NumberFormat Decimal format. If null then DecimalFormat.getNumberInstance() will be used.
        textFormat - Format. Custom formatter for text fields. May be used to encode text as HTML or similar transformations.
        Returns:
        String

      • toXML

        public String toXML(String identSpaces,
                    DateFormat dateFormat,
                    NumberFormat decimalFormat,
                    Format textFormat)
        Write Record as XML.
        Specified by:
        toXML in interface Record
        Parameters:
        identSpaces - String Number of indentation spaces at the beginning of each line.
        dateFormat - DateFormat Date format. If null then yyyy-MM-DD HH:mm:ss pattern will be used.
        decimalFormat - NumberFormat Decimal format. If null then DecimalFormat.getNumberInstance() will be used.
        textFormat - Format. Custom formatter for text fields. May be used to encode text as HTML or similar transformations.
        Returns:
        String
